instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01814: What is 820-01814? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_G3H: What is 3V3_G3H? This is one of the first power rails that must turn on for Macbooks that use USB-C for charging. This power rail powers the CD3215 chip that controls the USB-C charger, speaks to the USB-C charger, and requests 20 volts up from the default 5 volts that the USB-C charger puts out when initially connected to an unknown device. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .

threads.message: the  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> starts at 9.7v then jumps to 12.1v then down to 9.7v

threads.title: i have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no power no signs of water damage
threads.message:
Check the voltage on charger alone, without battery?
<SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> appears?

threads.title: i have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no power no signs of water damage
threads.message: with out battery the usb meter say 20v being pulled <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12v and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC_X</SIGNAL> 3.3v

threads.title: i have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no power no signs of water damage
threads.message:
Is now <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> steady?
Exactly 12V, not 12.3v, or 12.6?

Is the machine recognized in DFU mode?

threads.title: i have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no power no signs of water damage
i have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no power no signs of water damage
threads.message:
"Is the machine recognized in DFU mode?"
???

Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>?
If not, check all SLPS2R and AWAKE signals.

threads.title: i have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no power no signs of water damage
threads.message: i connected a macbook pro and use the configurator and it says dfu mode but it will not finish restore it says

threads.title: i have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no power no signs of water damage
threads.message:
Try revive option, instead of restore.
There could be a problem with SSD; T2 may not access its partition.

threads.title: i have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no power no signs of water damage

threads.title: i have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no power no signs of water damage
threads.message:
Should'n't be cable issue, if machine is recognized ion DFU.
However, always better to test, when in doubt.
Original Apple Thunderbolt 3 cable is 45â‚¬ (0.8m).
